member.name: T:System.Threading.Channels.ChannelOptions
member.summary: Provides options that control the behavior of channel instances.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Channels.ChannelOptions.SingleWriter
member.summary: true if writers to the channel guarantee that there will only ever be at most one write operation at a time; false if no such constraint is guaranteed.
member.remarks: If true, the channel may be able to optimize certain operations based on knowing about the single-writer guarantee. The default is false.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Channels.ChannelOptions.SingleReader
member.summary: true readers from the channel guarantee that there will only ever be at most one read operation at a time; false if no such constraint is guaranteed.
member.remarks: If true, the channel may be able to optimize certain operations based on knowing about the single-reader guarantee. The default is false.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Channels.ChannelOptions.AllowSynchronousContinuations
member.summary: true if operations performed on a channel may synchronously invoke continuations subscribed to notifications of pending async operations; false if all continuations should be invoked asynchronously.
member.remarks: Setting this option to true can provide measurable throughput improvements by avoiding scheduling additional work items. However, it may come at the cost of reduced parallelism, as for example a producer may then be the one to execute work associated with a consumer, and if not done thoughtfully, this can lead to unexpected interactions. The default is false.

member.name: T:System.Threading.Channels.BoundedChannelOptions
member.summary: Provides options that control the behavior of instances.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Channels.BoundedChannelOptions._capacity
member.summary: The maximum number of items the bounded channel may store.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Channels.BoundedChannelOptions._mode
member.summary: The behavior incurred by write operations when the channel is full.

member.summary: Initializes the options.
member.param: The maximum number of items the bounded channel may store.

member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of items the bounded channel may store.

member.name: P:System.Threading.Channels.BoundedChannelOptions.FullMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the behavior incurred by write operations when the channel is full.

member.summary: Provides options that control the behavior of instances.

member.summary: Sentinel object used to indicate being done writing.

member.summary: A cached task that never completes.

member.name: M:System.Threading.Channels.ChannelUtilities.Complete(System.Threading.Tasks.TaskCompletionSource{System.VoidResult},System.Exception)
member.summary: Completes the specified TaskCompletionSource.
member.param: The source to complete.

The optional exception with which to complete. If this is null or the DoneWritingSentinel, the source will be completed successfully. If this is an OperationCanceledException, it'll be completed with the exception's token. Otherwise, it'll be completed as faulted with the exception.

member.param: The waiters.
The value with which to complete each waiter.

member.summary: Wake up all of the waiters and null out the field.
member.param: The waiters.
The success value with which to complete each waiter if error is null.
The failure with which to cmplete each waiter, if non-null.

member.name: T:System.Threading.Channels.SingleConsumerUnboundedChannel`1
member.summary: Provides a buffered channel of unbounded capacity for use by any number of writers but at most a single reader at a time.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Channels.SingleConsumerUnboundedChannel`1._completion
member.summary: Task that indicates the channel has completed.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Channels.SingleConsumerUnboundedChannel`1._items
member.summary: A concurrent queue to hold the items for this channel. The queue itself supports at most one writer and one reader at a time; as a result, since this channel supports multiple writers, all write access to the queue must be synchronized by the channel.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Channels.SingleConsumerUnboundedChannel`1._runContinuationsAsynchronously
member.summary: Whether to force continuations to be executed asynchronously from producer writes.

member.name: F:System.Threading.Channels.SingleConsumerUnboundedChannel`1._doneWriting
member.summary: non-null if the channel has been marked as complete for writing.

member.summary: A waiting reader (e.g. WaitForReadAsync) if there is one.

member.summary: Initialize the channel.
